subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: How long should I run a session?
author: Michael Ed
full_text:
--0-1781686951-1288060150=:83395
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I set my sessions up at no more than 4 questions. I give them 15 seconds to=
 answer, and move to the next question. With the RS-12-469 radio, I get ple=
nty, and it is a bear if you have to go through more than 5 minutes of reco=
rding slice by slice to hear every possible message. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
Michael=
 Edwards.=C2=A0Founder of The Worldwide Radio Sweep EVP Alliance
http://www=
.facebook.com/group.php?gid=3D102193593178906
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0

-=
-- On Mon, 10/25/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


From: T=
im Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: How long sh=
ould I run a session?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, October 25,=
 2010, 9:22 PM


=C2=A0 



I think Frank said it best when he said it gets=
 tedious with longer sessions. =C2=A0As you do more sessions, you will want=
 to continue conversing with the Others for as long as possible. =C2=A0But,=
 upon playback, careful analysis (with headphones and Adobe Audition) takes=
 me an hour for every 5 minutes. =C2=A0So three sessions a week at 15 minut=
es a session can eat up a lot of time. =C2=A0So I try to keep my home sessi=
ons to 10 minutes or less. =C2=A0There are times when they are not too comm=
unicative and I keep pressing on past 15 minutes and I always dread it when=
 I do because there is so much more to listen to.


In the field, it is a d=
ifferent story. =C2=A0Session times can go from 15 to 40 minutes and leave =
you with a helluva lot of audio to consider. =C2=A0Being very active in inv=
estigations and home sessions can make going over the audio a very dreadful=
 process if you inundate yourself with longer sessions.


So my advice? =C2=
=A0Keep it under ten unless you are getting something fantastic. =C2=A0Also=
, keep a word file on every session file that documents the time and commun=
ication received in the session for future reference. =C2=A0Sometimes peopl=
e and messages come across that I got over a year ago and I would have neve=
r known it if it weren't for the files I keep.


Hope this helps.


On Mon,=
 Oct 25, 2010 at 9:12 PM, Adriana Jones <adrianamjones@...> wrote:


=
=C2=A0 



I would go at least 10 to 15 minutes, but that's just in my own =
experience, which is not very extensive. What do some others on here have t=
o say? I'm actually curious about this question myself.

--- In EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com, "imrudym" <imrudym@...> wrote:
>
> I have recently started do=
ing EVP Maker sessions in my home and have gotten results (Rudy's Folder) f=
rom two of the first four sessions. I have only been doing five minute sess=
ions at a time. Is this too long or too short of a session time?
>








=
